Docs.summary: Specifies the visual state of a scroll bar that is drawn with visual styles.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ScrollBarState> values correspond to the states of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> objects exposed by the following classes:
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.LeftTrackHorizontal>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.RightTrackHorizontal>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.LowerTrackVertical>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.UpperTrackVertical>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.ThumbButtonHorizontal>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.ThumbButtonVertical>
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ScrollBarState> values are also used as an argument in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBarRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> class methods that draw the scroll bar track, scroll box (also known as the thumb), and scroll box grip.
